comments.body:
@odersky, could you have a look at this one? I could not figure out what change in this PR affected this.

In master it fails with `value stripMargin2 is not a member of String` because `a` is not and `inline` `String`. But for some reason in this PR `stripMargin2` is accepted as a member of `a` and skips the check that `a` should be an inline parameter. It should fail before inlining the code.
